definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The lifeboat brought off all the crew.
sentences.chinese: 救生船把船上所有船員都救了出來。

sentences.english: The life boat slowly drifted away from the sinking ship.
sentences.chinese: 救生船慢慢地從下沉的船旁邊漂走。

sentences.english: The camera is placed in the sea, looking up at the lifeboat and beyond it.
sentences.chinese: 攝像機定位在海上，看着救生船，然後視線越過它。

sentences.english: The lifeboats and funnels were shrunk by 10%.
sentences.chinese: 救生船和煙囪的大小縮減了10%。

sentences.english: Two Aussies are adrift in a lifeboat.
sentences.chinese: 兩個澳大利亞人乘一艘救生船漂流在海上。

sentences.english: Survival was legitimate if you had been ordered by an Officer to get into a lifeboat.
sentences.chinese: 如果收到指令，奉命登上救生船是被允許的。

sentences.english: Of course there are enough lifeboats. Don't be frightened by Titanic.
sentences.chinese: 當然有足夠的救生船，別被《泰坦尼克號》嚇壞了。

sentences.english: The lifeboat went out to a ship in distress.
sentences.chinese: 救生船去救一艘遇險的船隻。

sentences.english: The frightened passengers tried to rush the lifeboat.
sentences.chinese: 驚慌的旅客都拼命往救生船擠去。

definition: tugboat/boat towed by a tugboat/to tow a boat
